message:
Lebanese channels report that Israeli fighter jets break the speed of sound over the skies of southern Lebanon.

It certainly bothers and scares the Lebanese - Nasrallah yesterday in his speech also addressed the issue of the intimidation it causes to the citizens of Lebanon.
Acting Iranian Foreign Minister, landed a short time ago in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, to participate in a special gathering of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation.

Acting Iranian Foreign Minister in a conversation with his British counterpart:

"The continued aggression of the Zionist entity on Lebanon and Palestine alongside the elimination of Haniyeh in Tehran is the only reason for the security upheaval in the region."

The protests in Bangladesh

Following the protests that led to the overthrow of the government and the exile of the Prime Minister of Bangladesh to India - rioters broke into the National Zoo of Bangladesh in an attempt to catch animals and take them home...

##
Some people steal from convenience stores, and then there are those who go straight to a zoo...

IDF Spokesperson:

The IDF has located and destroyed the launch sites that were positioned near UNRWA humanitarian aid warehouses.

These sites were identified as the source of recent launches towards the Lachish area and the surrounding communities.
Additional photos from Umm Tin.
Umm Tin, southern Israel: Israeli police forces enter the Bedouin village ahead of the demolition of illegally-built houses.

A historical photo from a Hamas delegation visit to Tehran.


In the picture:
1. Qasem Soleimani, commander of the Quds Force of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, who was killed by the Trump administration in 2020.

2. Ismail Haniyeh, former head of Hamas’s political bureau, who was killed in Tehran.

3. Yahya Sinwar, the new head of Hamas’s political bureau.

4. Rouhi Mushtah, a member of Hamas’s political bureau and Sinwar's right-hand man, who was reportedly killed in Gaza this week.

The Lebanese al-Akhbar newspaper, affiliated with the Shiite Axis, reports that Turkey and Egypt are negotiating a military procurement deal under which Turkey will supply Egypt with Turkish-made Bayraktar-type drones.

This report comes after the Turkish Foreign Minister's visit to Egypt and the Sinai Peninsula, as well as an anticipated visit by the Egyptian President to Turkey.

It seems that there is also a lot of action on the Tehran-Moscow air line...

Thanks to follower S.

Member of Knesset Waleed Alhwashla from the Ra'am party came to support the residents of Umm Tin in the Negev, who are burning tires to prevent illegal building destruction operations that are planned for today.

The Lebanese (Shiite) journalist, Dima Sadek (a prominent critic of Hezbollah) mocks a line from Nasrallah's speech yesterday in which he said: "This is not the campaign to destroy Israel. Our goal is to prevent Israel from winning."

Dima writes: If after committing the genocide in Gaza, killing 50,000 Palestinians, killing Muhammad Deif, killing Haniyeh and the most important military commander in Hezbollah, attacking Tehran, attacking Dahieh and causing the evacuation of the residents of southern Lebanon, and this is still not the campaign to eliminate Israel, then when will this campaign start?

##
You have to admit that the list of Israel's achievements looks really impressive when Dima describes it...
This certainly indicates the strength and achievements of Israel in the eyes of some of the spectators in the stands of the Middle East. Dima is saying here that the king of Lebanon is naked...

Shortly after midnight, the IDF spokesman issued an evacuation notice in Arabic for Gazans who are in Beit Hanoun, Sheikh Zayed and Almanshiya in the northern Gaza Strip.
This follows the firing of rockets yesterday evening from the north of the Gaza Strip towards Ashkelon.

In the meantime, I have not come across photos and videos of population evacuations on social networks.
It seems that the effect of evacuation notices has worn off a bit, especially when it is not accompanied by significant military action.

Rabih Al-Anbusi "the ghost" of the Tubas Battalion (Islamic Jihad):

How it started
How it ended

The explanation courtesy of the IDF spokesman (yesterday evening):

An IDF force from Unit 636, which carried out a proactive activity near the settlement of Beka'ot in the Bekaa and Emekim Division, eliminated an armed terrorist who tried to carry out a shooting attack a short time ago. There are no casualties to our forces.

Hamas-identified channels publish satellite footage of the area near the Ibn Taymiyya mosque in the Brazil neighborhood of Rafah (south of the Gaza Strip) - before and after.
The pictures speak for themselves.

مسحوها مسح.
Yemen: Media outlets affiliated with the Shia axis report that American and British warplanes attacked Houthi targets in the Taizz district south of the capital Sana'a early in the morning.
Documentation of some of the landings of the American F22 planes in the British military field Lakenheath

The US Airlift to the region continues

Reports of a large number of American cargo flights from the military base in Alaska towards the Middle East, apparently to the American air base in Qatar.
Foreign media also report on 12 American F-18 A fighter jets that arrived in "one of the countries of the region" in the past day.

In addition, 6 American F-22 aircraft were observed landing at a British military airport, as an intermediate stop before their arrival in the Middle East.

impressive.
The Palestinians report that Israel blew up the headquarters of the Fatah movement in the Balata refugee camp in Nablus early this morning, after an operation in the camp.
Sidon, Lebanon: A motorcycle procession following the election of Sinwar as chairman of the political bureau of Hamas.

Congratulations are pouring in from all over the Middle East on the occasion of the appointment of Yahya Sinwar, Abu Ibrahim, as the chairman of the political bureau of Hamas.
Hezbollah, the Islamic Jihad, the Palestinian factions and more and more all congratulate him on the occasion of the appointment.

Sinwar has not been seen in public since the outbreak of the war...

In the photos - Yahya Sinwar as a young man.
